scenarioDescription:
The GJ 180 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 180 is a star with 0.43 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 38.95 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 180 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 180 system


GJ 180 b

GJ 180 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2014-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 180 b is 6.494 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 180 b is 2.430 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 180 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


GJ 180 c

GJ 180 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2014-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 180 c is 6.405 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 180 c is 2.410 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 180 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


GJ 180 d

GJ 180 d was discovered by the Multiple Facilities observatory, in 2020-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.31 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 180 d is 7.565 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 180 d is 2.660 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 180 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system GJ 180, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: GJ 180 - System With 3 Exoplanets
